This file defines functions for generating available movesTODO constants for directions? Directions are in CCW order, starting from EAST TODO introduce some neat syntax (macro) to make code more readable

Imports

board, precalc, templates

Types

Move = object
  piece*: Piece                ## Piece being moved. UNDO_MOVE represents a takeback
  frm*: Square                 ## Departure square.
  to*: Square                  ## Destination square.
  capturedPiece*: Piece        ## Piece being captured or NO_PIECE if the move is quiet.
  promotion*: Piece            ## Piece being promoted to or NO_PIECE if the move is not a promotion.
Move object.

func `$`(move: Move): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Generates a simple UCI string representation of a move. This representation is position independant. See toAlgebraic for a position dependant algebraic notation repr. 
func parseMove(board: Board; s: string): Move {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Parses a simple UCI (position independant) string representation of a move. See parseAlgebraic for a position dependant algebraic notation parsing. 
func firstSquare(board: BB): Square {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the first set bit of a Bitboard. For Sliding pieces, its important that EMPTY maps to 63.

Determines if position is legal, that is if activeColor doesn't attack opponent's king.

func isMate(board: Board): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Determines if position is a mate (checkmate or stalemate). Alias for not moveExists. 
func isStalemate(board: Board): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Determines if position is a stalemate. 
func isCheckmate(board: Board): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Determines if a position is a checkmate. 
func toAlgebraic(board: Board; m: Move): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns a (position dependant) string representation of a move in a standard (PGN) algebraic notation. 
func parseAlgebraic(board: Board; m: string): Move {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Parses a move from an algebraic notation. Does so by generating Alg. notations for all legal moves and comparing it. Therefore m must take a form board.toAlgebraic(move) where board.fromAlgebraic(m) == move. If m doesn't match any legal move, Move(piece:NULL_MOVE) is returned.
